oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Schools; Public Schools; Educational facilities
Education - Tennessee; Education - History - Tennessee; School buildings - Tennessee
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Front view of Hickman County High School in Centerville. The picture shows a long brick structure with two floors and a basement. Multiple windows can be seen. The building has a unique entrance with a cupola. A low fence and light pole stand in front.

Hickman County High School was originally listed as Fairview Academy in Hickman County histories. As an academy, the building was opened in 1903. It is not known when it became the Hickman County High School. Although a historic building, it was not saved.
